title: The debounce technique for JavaScript form validation
description: We use the debounce technique for JavaScript form validation to prevent excessive validation calls, improve performance, reduce network/API calls and more.

title: What is a Batch DOM update and Why is it useful?
description: Batching DOM updates refers to making multiple changes to the DOM in a way that reduces the number of reflows and repaints, which are costly operations for the browser.

title: What are the best practices for optimizing CSS to reduce unnecessary reflows and repaints, especially in large-scale applications?
description: A reflow (also called layout or re-layout) occurs when the browser recalculates the position, size, and layout of elements on the page.

title: Mastering React Performance by useMemo Hook
description: The useMemo hook in React is used to optimize performance by memoizing (remembering) the result of a computation so that it doesn't need to be recalculated unnecessarily.

title: Boost Performance with Memoized Functions by useCallback in React
description: useCallback is a React Hook used to memoize functions, which means it ensures that a function doesnâ€™t get re-created unless its dependencies change.

title: Simplify and Reuse Your Component Logic by Custom Hook in React.js
description: A custom hook in React is a JavaScript function that lets you extract reusable logic from components.
